sentences: Francis Christian Cabrel (French pronunciation: ​[fʁɑ̃sis kʁistjɑ̃ kabʁɛl]; born 23 November 1953) is a French singer-songwriter, composer and guitarist.
His first hit song was "Petite Marie" in 1974, which was about the woman who soon became his wife, Mariette.
Francis Cabrel was born in Agen, Lot-et-Garonne into a modest family of Friulian descent.
He spent his childhood in Astaffort, in Lot-et-Garonne.
